meanings.definition: Imperators: plural form of imperator, a title given to a victorious general in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent1: The imperators led their armies to great victories.
meanings.sent2: The ancient Roman imperators were respected for their military achievements.
meanings.sent3: The imperators decided to celebrate their triumph with a grand feast.
meanings.sent4: In history books, the imperators are portrayed as fearless leaders.
meanings.sent5: The word 'imperators' brings to mind images of powerful Roman generals.

meanings.definition: Imperators: third person singular present of imperator, to command or order with authority.
meanings.sent1: He imperators his troops to march forward.
meanings.sent2: The king imperators his subjects to obey the law.
meanings.sent3: The teacher imperators the students to complete their homework on time.
meanings.sent4: The coach imperators the team to give their best performance.
meanings.sent5: The boss imperators everyone to attend the meeting promptly.
